Term.Name: Linear Fade
Term.Definition: Also called "constant gain". A linear shape.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Logarithmic Fade
Term.Definition: Also called "constant power". A more smoother, less abrupt transition with a logarithmic shape.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Reverse Logarithmic Fade
Term.Definition: Also called "constant power". A more smoother, less abrupt transition with a logarithmic shape, but the inverse version.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: S-Curve
Term.Definition: Beginng and end have a slow, less steep curve while in the center can become quite steep.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Bezier
Term.Definition: A mouldable shape which can be modelled by the user.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Hard Fade
Term.Definition: Not really a fade. There is no gradual transition, just a hard change.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project
